page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: THE SAMPLE FARM COMPRISES 445 HECTARES OF LOW LYING LAND AROUND LONCO BROOK(03740322). LIKE MOST OF THE STUDY AREA THE SOILS ARE FORMED ON GLACIAL DEPOSITS WHICH OVERLAY SANDSTONE. THE FARMING IS "MIXED" WITH WHEAT, BARLEY, POTATOES, SUGAR BEET, OIL SEED RAPE AND PEAS BEING THE MAIN CROPS. LIVESTOCK IS PREDOMINANTLY DAIRY COWS AND BEEF CATTLE, SOME INTENSIVELY KEPT PIGS WERE RECORDED BUT NO SHEEP WERE SEEN. MOST OF THE FARMS PRACTISE CROP ROTATION AND THE FARM STUDIED USED A FOUR YEAR CYCLE OF WHEAT,POTATOES, BARLEY, SUGAR BEET. THE GRASSLAND AREAS WERE MAINLY TEMPORARY LEYS WHICH WERE RESOWN EVERY THREE OR FOUR YEARS. THIS ENSURED HIGH YIELDS AND LOW WEED ENCROACHMENT.
